meanings.definition: Used as a mild expression of annoyance or surprise.
meanings.sent1: Heck! I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent3: Heck, I can't believe I tripped over my own shoelaces.
meanings.sent4: When the cake fell on the floor, she exclaimed, 'Heck!'
meanings.sent5: The sudden rainstorm caught us off guard - 'Heck!' we all shouted.

meanings.definition: A place or situation regarded as unpleasant or difficult.
meanings.sent1: The old abandoned house looked like a haunted heck.
meanings.sent2: The hike up the steep mountain was a real heck.
meanings.sent3: Finding a parking spot in the crowded city was a heck of a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The waiting room felt like a heck where time stood still.
meanings.sent5: The swamp was a heck of mosquitoes buzzing around us.
